verses.roman:
evaṁ me puṇḍarīkākṣa
mahāntaṁ saṁśayaṁ hṛdi
chettum arhasi sarva-jña
vacobhir naya-naipuṇaiḥ

synonyms: evam—thus; me—my; puṇḍarīka-akṣa—O lotus-eyed Lord; mahāntam—great; saṁśayam—doubt; hṛdi—within my heart; chettum—cut; arhasi—You should please; sarva-jña—O omniscient one; vacobhiḥ—with Your words; naya—in reasoning; naipuṇaiḥ—very expert.
translation: O lotus-eyed Kṛṣṇa, O omniscient Lord, kindly cut this great doubt out of my heart with Your own words, which exhibit Your great skill in reasoning.

purport.content: Śrī Uddhava requests Lord Kṛṣṇa to clearly demonstrate the difference between the material body and the spirit soul.
